page.title: 01Gt Haseley & Milton Common
page.content: Gt Haseley is a small village with several farms, a church , a public house, and a primary school. The houses are mainly constructed of local stone, the more modern houses , particularly local authority ones are of brick. Many of the latter have recently been purchased by the occupants. It is significant that the village has no shops although there were several until ten years ago. Milton Common, the other part of the area with a number of habitations grew up alongside the A40 Oxford to London road. This road has become less important with the construction of the M40 Motorway, but Milton Common has become a service area for same. A hotel,a public house and several garages are found there. by G.L. Walker.
